column4: Help! I've started a dist upgrade, but now it keeps hanging at "Memtest86+ is being prepared"
have you made a backup before you triggered the upgrade?
no.. unfortunately i didn't
... greetings from Murphys Law. What version are you upgrading from?
using the update-manager or the console?
update-manager
see /var/log/apt/term.log to get a clue what might be wrong
there's nothing in there..
are ther archived files in that dir (with a quite recent time-stamp)?
the timestamp on the files archived, are from 2 days ago
shouldn't i be looking in the /var/log/dist-upgrade folder?
ok, so it seems that update-manager hasn't logged anything useful. SInce it hangs anyway you probably have no choice other than killing it and sort out the damage manually
Okay then.. let's try to kill it and restart it again.. hopefully nothing will be badly damaged! Thanks for the help! :)
don't run update-manager yet, try sudo apt-get -f install first
a dpkg --reconfigure -a also triggered some installing things.
good. the idea is to fix broken dependencies and configure pending packages before you retry to do an upgrade. Maybe it that even completes the upgrade by itself
Normally, the update didn't give me any trouble...

you should be wise enough to know 2 things: 1.) never do anything potentially dangerous without a backup. 2.) ubuntu releases are time-based. This implies: not ready yet, not well-tested. sysadmins always wait at least 4 weeks before they upgrade :-\
Yeah.. i know.. well.. it wouldn't be that bad if i lost linux right now.. i only installed it 4 days ago
you might consider a clean reinstall then anyway
well.. lets just hope this all works out right :)
